page.title: 01The Crawford Area.
page.content: The village of Crawford forms part of our area.Crawford is a small village with a population of around 350. Crawford lies beside the A74,the River Clyde and the main Glasgow/ London Railway. Although Crawford is small,it is a village with a lot of history.William Wallace,the Champion of the Scots burnt down Crawford Castle 700 years ago. The area around Crawford consists mainly of hill land with rough grazing.The highest hill is Rodger Law which is 540 metres above sea-level. There are also some small woods and several burns,which are tributaries of the Clyde. Crawford is a very nice place in which to live.
